text: Allan James McDonald (July 9, 1937 â€“ March 6, 2021) was an American engineer, aerospace consultant and author. He was the director of the Space Shuttle Solid Rocket Motor Project for Morton-Thiokol. In January 1986, he refused to sign off on a launch of the Space Shuttle Challenger which broke apart 73 seconds into flight. McDonald died in Ogden, Utah at the age of 83 on March 6, 2021.
